title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-2.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8187-2.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

In addition to the definitions in section
8187-1.1
of this Part, when used in this Subpart: (a) Applicant or applicants shall mean the
person, or persons, who execute and file a complaint. (b) Chief executive officer shall mean, in
the case of a city, the mayor or city manager, and in the case of a town, the
supervisor (if a town has more than one supervisor, the presiding
supervisor). (c) Complainant shall
mean the tax district for which a complaint has been filed in behalf of the
taxpayers thereof pursuant to this Part. (d) Respondent shall mean the county board of
supervisors in a county which has made an equalization of assessments for
cities and towns within the county for purposes of county taxation pursuant to
the provisions of title 1 of article 8 of the Real Property Tax Law, or in such
county a tax district, other than a tax district for which a complaint has been
filed pursuant to this Part, which has notified the State Board of Real

Property Tax Services of its intention to appear before such board in
connection with such review. (e) Tax district shall mean a city or town. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8187-2.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
